Values of the company mission are not reflected in  company policy. Adoption and family is promoted as a major pillar of a Christian life for the company but maternity or paternity leave are not granted as they only offer short term disability to their employees for new babys. The caviot is adopted children do not require medical leave. A. Strategy is lacking and leadership seems to be oblivious to the impact it has in their people and productivity.

review_title: Struggling non-profit with too many cooks in the kitchen
pros: Co-workers are generally great people--and managers do typically care about their employees.
cons: No one is ever held accountable--ROI is never calculated and things are done on a whim without much thought beforehand. Employees are not empowered to make decisions and about 2/3 of all meetings are a waste of time. Hope you like red tape--because its everywhere. Mediocrity is the norm and little no career advancement opportunities. Focus wants to change, and it talks big but that's all it is--talk. Focus used to be a career employer but not anymore. There's a continuous exodus to other non-profits in the area. Above its a good ol' boys club and it tends to trickle down. While no organization is perfect, the dysfunction here is especially rampant and can sometimes be hard for outsiders. Layoffs are a common occurrence and departments are operating well below capacity, which puts a lot of stress on everyone.

review_title: So much better than it's reputation.
